title: Josh Hutcherson Calls Hollywood's Gender Pay Gap 'Mind-Blowing'
text:
Josh Hutcherson Calls Hollywood's Gender Pay Gap 'Mind-Blowing' Posted today at 10:00am 
ABC/Rick Rowell (LOS ANGELES) -- Josh Hutcherson said he couldn't be more proud than he is of his Hunger Games co-star Jennifer Lawrence, who caused headlines by penning an essay on the wage gap in Hollywood. 
"For Jen to use her platform to speak about it in her classic Jen way, just blunt, saying what she thinks, I think it’s great," he tells MTV . "Obviously it’s something that should have happened decades and decades and decades ago, and the fact that it’s something we’re still dealing with now is f embarrassing and shocking." 
Lawrence recently published an essay for Lena Dunham's newsletter, Lenny , in which the actress admitted that she regretted not negotiating more money in her contract while filming American Hustle. Her co-stars Bradley Cooper and Jeremy Renner have both publicly said they support Lawrence's stance on equal pay for women. 
Hutcherson revealed that Lawrence is not usually one to tackle controversial issues, but that he is "really proud" of the actress for speaking her mind. 
“She’s always been a little gun-shy…she’s always said what she thinks, but as far as tackling issues, she’s never really stepped up to do that," he continued. "It’s nice to see her now taking that step, being progressive, and using her voice not just to make people laugh.”
